pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [4c32301b84](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15062/commits/4c32301b84403940cd4cefb3e399cd05a8e8d3a8)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Sites.LocallyFullyFaithful`|879|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Functor.imageSieve`
`+ Functor.imageSieve_eq_imageSieve`
`+ Functor.imageSieve_map`
`+ IsLocallyFaithful`
`+ IsLocallyFaithful.ext`
`+ IsLocallyFull`
`+ IsLocallyFull.ext`
`+ Sieve.equalizer`
`+ Sieve.equalizer_eq_equalizerSieve`
`+ Sieve.equalizer_self`
`+ functorPushforward_equalizer_mem`
`+ functorPushforward_imageSieve_mem`
`+ instance (priority := 900) IsLocallyFaithful.of_faithful [G.Faithful] : G.IsLocallyFaithful K`
`+ instance (priority := 900) IsLocallyFull.of_full [G.Full] : G.IsLocallyFull K`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10074537667/job/27850880376)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10074537667/job/27850880843)

```suggestion
For a functor `G : C  D`, and a morphism `f : G.obj U  G.obj V`,
```

I would rather see these definitions in the `Functor` namespace. I may suggest names like `Functor.imageSieve` and `Functor.equalizerSieve` in order to have names that are parallel to what we have for the definition of locally injective/surjective morphisms of presheaves. (The notions should be kind of related, but are not because of universe heterogeneity.)

I have renamed it to `Functor.imageSieve` and added a lemma connecting it to `Presheaf.imageSieve`. However `Sieve.equalizer` does not mention functors in its definition and I'm not sure if I should make the same change there.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory/Site): Locally fully-faithful functors into sites.
